name: create_element
description: Create a BPMN element. Place it at an arbitrary position or append it to another element.

source_element_id_or_name.description: The id or name of the source element which to append to. Use the id if the element already exists in the process, otherwise the name. This creates automatically a connection between the new element and the provided source.

new_element_name.description: The name of the new element.

bpmn_type.description: The BPMN type of the element. Possible types are: 'Task','StartEvent','EndEvent','ExclusiveGateway','InclusiveGateway','ParallelGateway'.

connection_label.description: The label of the connection if the new element is appended to another one. This label is used when the source element is a gateway and the connection is taken conditionally. The label tells us what condition has to be met in order to take this connection.

position.description: The position where the new element should be placed. Only needed when the element is not appended to another element. Do not provide this parameter if source_element_id_or_name is provided. Use for the first start event the position x=350 and y=200.

name: create_connection
description: Create a connection between two elements. Only needed if the connection has not been created yet.

label.description: The label of the connection. Only needed if the connection comes from a gateway and is only taken, when a certain condition is met.

source_element_id_or_name.description: The id or name of the source element of the connection. User the id if the element already exists in the process, otherwise the name.

target_element_id_or_name.description: The id or name of the target element of the connection. User the id if the element already exists in the process, otherwise the name.

name: remove_elements
description: Remove BPMN elements. Removing an element also removes all associated connections. Connections are also considered elements and can be seperately removed too by including their id here.

element_ids.description: The ids of the elements to be removed.
